data.title: Show your playbill!
data.text: I was in Plano to see my granddaughter in a production of Le Miz.  Because we were coming from various places we decided to eat at Angela's before the matinee performance.  Convenient location and known to be supportive of events at Plano's Children's Theatre it was an obvious choice.  My first time there.  Noisy yes, but so friendly and great food!  My daughter had cooked huge breakfast earlier forgetting the closeness of hours.  She and I planned to have a snack.  Ha!  Not only did we eat a great lunch but even indulged in fabulous desserts.   Later on my program for Le Miz I saw add for this restaurant indicating if you show your playbill you'd get a complimentary order of fried pickles or bruschetta.  A variety of ages were there; everyone having a great time.  Not to be missed!

data.title: Tried and tried again!
data.text: I wanted to support Angela's. I like the atmosphere and support all of our local restaurants., but the food on three occasions has been below average and on our last trip, even bad. I've visited for breakfast, and lunch and even had my daughters graduation lunch there and was embarrassed when one of my guests had a screw from a piece of kitchen equipment in her grits!!  I think staffing is an issue, and while our waitress was trying her very best, there was no bartender so the signature drinks were unavailable and many of the food specials were out as well. Why when I called to make the reservation did they not inform me of this? Why do they have such a hard time keeping employees? I want to love Angela's but something big has to change

data.title: Good place, nice atmosphere, music
data.text: Happened on this place since it is next to our favorite pizza restaurant.  Really liked the atmosphere, the live music.  People were friendly and food very good.  Highly recommended for casual dining and listening to the music.

data.title: A gem!
data.text: We visited this place for a quick lunch, and what a gem we found! We were greeted by the most friendly lady which made us feel right at home. And the food was absolutely delicious! Loved the surroundings as well. We will definetly be back when we return to Plano!

data.title: All about the pie
data.text: My boyfriend discovered Angela's googling coconut pie, our favorite. The first coconut pie was not the best as the crust seemed old. They asked to allow them the replace it and we later went back for another. The crust this time was excellent.  The pie was delicious -  not too sweet as some coconut pies can be. We have since been back a few times.

data.title: Great place to grab lunch with friends
data.text: While shopping and exploring downtown Plano, we happened upon Angela's. Loved the décor of exposed building brick. The dessert case looked awesome! We had the Quiche Florentine, and loved every crumb! Hope you enjoy it too!

data.title: Delicious Quiche
data.text: This is a small little restaurant that serves up a delicious quiche for breakfast! Our waitress was quick and smiled a lot. I didn't have one of their sticky buns with pecans on top, but they looked huge and very tempting! We data yes there for a few hours because we were visiting friends we haven't seen in years, and nobody tried to rush is out of there which made it very comfortable.

data.title: Adorable place for brunch
data.text:
I have friends who go to this diner for Trivia night. I've never been so I thought I would try it out for brunch Friday since I love pie.

It is in downtown Plano which is this really cute little area where some of the streets are made of brick. This place is in a row of local restaurants and shops. If you're lucky, you may be able to find parking close by. Otherwise, be prepared to walk a couple of blocks after you park your car (or drive in circles until a spot opens up).

The restaurant itself is small. It's got a country rustic kind of theme to it. It's very clean. 

I ordered the eggs benedict. Everything about it was delicious including the potatoes that came with them. For dessert, I had an apple turnover a la mode (with vanilla bean ice cream). It was warm and flaky and just perfect! 

The only reason I didn't rate this restaurant a 5 is that the service was a little lacking. It didn't seem very busy (there were maybe another 4-5 parties aside from us) but we waited awhile for our waitress to come by. I almost didn't order dessert because she took too long to check on us when we finished our entrees.

data.title: Good food
data.text: We have eaten there several times! each time something different and it is always good ! The menu is always changing and it makes for good variety - service is always great !

data.title: Yum
data.text: I will always love Angela's At The Crosswalk. I ventured in with my family a few years ago to try their pie, we have since come in over the years to eat many things. It is very much comfort food and the servers are very attentive and kind.  Great lunch spot, even a nice date night here when they have featured musicians.  Everything we have had has always been yummy , my favorite though is their pies.

data.title: Very good food
data.text: I have tried the chicken fried chix, eggs Benedict , lasagna, fried pickles, etc. All of the food is very good. The brunch is the best with fresh coffee or a variety of yummy teas. They have a separate menu for teas. The best sweet waitress is a grandmother that walks to work!! Open mic night is great, and I had a yummy Vegas bomb drink.

data.title: Nice food
data.text: Came for dinner and had the fried chicken and waffles.  The chicken was very moist and succulent and the waffle was cooked just right.

data.title: Unsanitary Restroom/Sewer Issues!
data.text: I guess the others who raved about this place didn't make it back to the restroom area.  We were there last night for dinner with another couple before going dancing.  The food was good, except we ordered fries with our hamburger and got potato chips.  The waiter said the fries are coming, but they never came.  Also, we ordered cheese on our burger which we didn't get but I am sure we paid for it.  However, the biggest issue we had was the horrible sewer smell and unhealthy condition of their restrooms.  You cannot even go in to wash your hands for the terrible smell.  And there were flies in the dining area.  When we brought it to the attention of the waiter, and he simply shrugged it off saying..."oh, I know we have had some problems..."  A restaurant should not be open to the public and serving food with serious sewer issues like what we experienced. Perhaps this is something that should be brought to the attention of the local Health Dept.  Unfortunately, we will not be back to Angela's on the Crosswalk even if they do get their restrooms up to code.

data.title: New Chef Does it Right
data.text: There's a new chef at Angela's and the dinners show it. Because of the spotty food quality, we had quit going there for anything other than breakfast or Angela's pie. But on the spur-of-the-moment, we decided to give the newest chef a try. Glad we did. My veggie lasagna was quite good. My mixed greens salad was beautiful and the vinaigrette dressing was outstanding. (Hint: start with just a tiny bit--the flavor is intense.) My husband said his patty melt was good enough he'd order it again. His house made potato chips were delish. They would make a super snack with a beer. Even though the restaurant was busy, service was attentive. We can now recommend Angela's for any meal.

data.title: Best chicken fried steak!
data.text: Angela's has the best Chicken Fried Steak!  I am sure their other dishes are delicious but me and my son always get CFS.  Crispy coating, mashed potatoes and a side of green beans makes an excellent CFS!  Finish off your meal with a slice of pie and a nice hot cup of coffee.

data.title: Always a very good breakfast
data.text: We've eaten here a number of time, and the food and service are always very good.  Breakfast has been our main meal, and it never disappoints.  Their biscuits and gravy are very good (not usually a favorite of mine at most places) and their waffles are great.  Service has always been very friendly and timely.  This last visit, we were happy to share Angela's with friends visiting from out of state before they left town, and they enjoyed it as well.

data.title: Wake up please
data.text:
I read the reviews and they were mixed. The service was great. The food was bland at best and cold. The restroom was very dirty. You have to walk by the kitchen to use the restroom...it was a total mess. Dirty dish all over the place...ouch

We will not be back!

data.title: It's Awesome!
data.text: My wife enjoyed a truly delicious anniversary dinner at Angela's at the Crosswalk. The service was impeccable, and the food was delicious. My wife enjoyed the Mom's meatloaf which was in her words, "awesome." The green bean tomato saute was excellent as was my Angela's lasagna. Fortunately we saved room for delicious cherry pie and coconut cream pie for dessert. The ambiance is great. I highly recommend this wonderful restaurant in downtown Plano!

data.title: Ok but nothing stellar
data.text: Although the atmosphere was welcoming and waitress was sweet, the food was average. For a simple diner experience it was ok, but we were not over impressed by the flavors and experience. The eggs were cold and the syrup bottles were pretty nasty (hair on the lid).

data.title: Lovely little eatery in Downtown Plano
data.text: Love this place.  It's close to Dart in cute little Downtown Plano.  I've been here several times.  My favorite dish is the eggs benedict. The cinnamon rolls are also delicious and huge!  My four kids split one every time we go.  Great brunch spot!
